1.speaker: polar bear
1.japanese: みんな　揃ったかな

2.speaker: lesser
2.japanese: ご招待ありがとうございます
2.english: Thank you very much for the invitation.

5.speaker: king
5.japanese: なんだかストレス解消になりそうね
5.english: It'll probably be great for relieving stress.

9.speaker: panda
9.japanese: 張り切ってるね　シロクマ君
9.english: Polar Bear is totally ready to do this. {\a6}All right, here you go.

10.speaker: polar bear
10.japanese: 一年に一度の豆まきだからね
10.english: Well, we only scatter beans once a  year. {\a6}There.

11.speaker: polar bear
11.japanese: さて　誰が鬼の役をやる
11.english: All right. Who's going to be the ogre?

13.speaker: penguin
13.japanese: えっ　パンダ君がやるの？
13.english: What? You're going to do it, Panda?

14.speaker: panda
14.japanese: 鬼ってなんかワイルドかっこいいもん
14.english: Being the ogre sounds super awesome!

21.speaker: panda
21.japanese: もうちょっと優しくしてよ
21.english: Couldn't you throw a little softer?

22.speaker: king
22.japanese: ちょっと　文句つける鬼なんて初めて聞いたわよ
22.english: Hey! I never heard of an ogre complaining!

23.speaker: panda
23.japanese: だって　痛いんだもん

24.speaker: lesser
24.japanese: じゃあ　ソフトにいきますね
24.english: We'll throw it a little softer, then.

27.speaker: panda
27.japanese: まだ痛いって気分になるな

29.speaker: king
29.japanese: 相当優しくしてるわよ

30.speaker: polar bear
30.english: Then we'll do one bean at a time.

33.speaker: penguin
33.japanese: いや　それ豆まきじゃないでしょ
33.english: I don't think that's scattering beans.

35.speaker: panda
35.japanese: 豆かして　自分でやるよ
35.english: Give me some beans. I'll do it myself.

36.speaker: penguin
36.japanese: 鬼が自分でぶつける豆まきなんてないでしょ
36.english: I've never heard of a case where the ogre throws beans at itself.

37.speaker: panda
37.japanese: あってもいいじゃない

39.speaker: king
39.japanese: 全然盛り上がらないわね

40.speaker: polar bear
40.japanese: もっと鬼っぽいほうがいいよね
40.english: We should get someone that looks more like an ogre.

41.speaker: penguin
41.japanese: ああ　最初から鬼っぽいよね
41.english: Yeah, he does look like an ogre to begin with.

42.speaker: panda
42.english: You don't even need a mask.

43.speaker: polar bear
43.japanese: じゃあ　マンドリル君　よろしく
43.english: Well, I guess it's you, Mandrill.

44.speaker: mandrill
44.japanese: 私去年も鬼だったので…
44.english: But I was the ogre last year, too...

45.speaker: polar bear
45.english: Now that you mention it... Sorry about that.

46.speaker: mandrill
46.japanese: なので…今年は食べるほうを頑張ります
46.english: And so, I'll do my best to eat the beans this year.

47.speaker: sasako
47.english: It's a little early for that.

48.speaker: penguin
48.japanese: じゃあ　僕がやるよ

51.speaker: penguin
51.japanese: そもそも なんで豆まきをするか知ってる
51.english: Do you all know why we scatter beans?

52.speaker: sasako
52.japanese: えっと　悪い気をはらうんじゃなかったでしたっけ
52.english: Um... wasn't it so we can expel negative energy?

53.speaker: penguin
53.japanese: そう　季節の変わり目は邪気が生じるから
53.english: Precisely! The changing of the seasonsbrings in negative energy.

54.speaker: penguin
54.japanese: それをはらうためにやるんだよ
54.english: We scatter beans to extinguish it.

55.speaker: penguin
55.japanese: そして　一年の無病息災を願う
55.english: Then we wish for a healthy rest of the year.

56.speaker: penguin
56.japanese: なぜ豆を投げるかというと

57.japanese: 豆は　魔を滅亡させるからでございます
57.english: is because they get rid of evil.

58.speaker: penguin
58.japanese: それに　ご隠居さん
58.english: And, old-timer, the beans that you use have to be roasted beans.

59.speaker: penguin
59.japanese: 生の大豆だと　拾い忘れて芽が出ることがありまして…
59.english: If you use raw soy beans, and they are left on the ground, they may start sprout— That's enough! And you started to do comedic storytelling while you were talking!

60.speaker: king
60.japanese: この子たちも飽きちゃったわよ
60.english: The kids are completely bored now!

63.speaker: penguin
63.english: I guess I don't have a choice.

71.speaker: lesser
71.english: Ogres outside! No, the part after "ogres." You're supposed to stretch it out longer.

73.speaker: panda
73.japanese: ペンギンさん　細かいな

74.speaker: penguin
74.japanese: 大切でしょ　かけ声は

75.speaker: penguin
75.japanese: はい　じゃあ　いってみよう

77.japanese: ちょっと　ちょっと

78.speaker: penguin
78.japanese: ラマさんと　ゾウガメ君も一緒にやろうよ
78.english: Mr. Llama and Tortoise, you guys need to participate, too!

82.speaker: penguin
82.japanese: 何かあるんじゃないの 投げる方法
82.english: Can't you think of some way to throw?

83.speaker: llama
83.japanese: 僕　口から飛ばします
83.english: I-I can do it from my mouth.

84.speaker: tortoise
84.japanese: じゃあ　鼻の穴から
84.english: Then... I can do it... from my nose...

85.speaker: polar bear
85.japanese: やる気だけ受け取っておこうか
85.english: Let's just accept their will to participate.

86.speaker: penguin
86.japanese: じゃあ　もう１回　リハーサルしようか
86.english: All right, let's rehearse this one more time.

87.speaker: penguin
87.english: Take your stance... and then throw!

90.speaker: penguin
90.japanese: 笹子さん　もうちょっと元気よく
90.english: Miss Sasako, with a little more feeling!

91.speaker: penguin
91.japanese: パンダ君　豆当たってないから

92.speaker: penguin
92.japanese: シロクマ君あんまり上から投げないで
92.english: Don't throw from so high up, Polar Bear. All right, remember the parts I coached you on.

93.english: Let's get this started! Why is no one throwing?

94.speaker: panda
94.japanese: もう　ペンギンさんの鬼はいいよ
94.english: We're done with you as the ogre.

95.speaker: king
95.english: The ogre is being too demanding.

99.speaker: penguin
99.english: But I'm not the ogre anymore.

102.speaker: llama
102.japanese: どうぞ　豆をぶつけてください
102.english: Please, hit me with the beans.

103.speaker: panda
103.japanese: ラマさんの鬼　優しそう
103.english: Mr. Llama's ogre looks really kind.

104.speaker: king
104.japanese: なんだか　ぶつけにくいわね
104.english: It's a little hard to hit him.

106.speaker: llama
106.japanese: 今は鬼ですから どうぞどうぞ
106.english: But I'm the ogre right now. So, please, don't hold back.

109.speaker: llama
109.english: All right, I think it's about time.

110.speaker: llama
110.japanese: それでは　鬼は外に
110.english: Is it all right if the ogre excuses himself outside?

111.speaker: panda
111.japanese: 豆まきの感じがしないな
111.english: This doesn't feel like bean scattering.

116.speaker: tortoise
116.japanese: どんどん　ぶつけて

118.speaker: penguin
118.japanese: 確かに遠慮なく投げられるけど…
118.english: It's true that we don't have to hold back at all...

119.speaker: lesser
119.japanese: 豆がみんな弾き飛ばされますね
119.english: But all the beans are being repelled. See-saw, see-saw! Saw... {\a6}See-saw, see-saw! {\a6}See-saw...

120.speaker: sasako
120.japanese: なかなか鬼が決まりませんね
120.english: Looks like we're having trouble finding an ogre...

121.speaker: penguin
121.japanese: じゃあ　やっぱり僕が
121.english: Then it's up to me again.

122.speaker: king
122.japanese: アンタは　もういいわよ
122.english: No, we've had enough of you.

123.speaker: lesser
123.english: Then who should be it? Roar!

124.speaker: penguin
124.japanese: それは赤鬼のつもりかな
124.english: Are you trying to be a red ogre?

129.speaker: penguin
129.japanese: それ　ナマハゲだから

133.speaker: penguin
133.english: Could you please just do this seriously?

134.speaker: king
134.japanese: 誰か　他に鬼っぽい人いないの シロクマさん
134.english: Isn't there anyone else who's like an ogre, Mr. Polar Bear? So cool! He fits the ogre image perfectly.

135.speaker: sasako
135.japanese: どことなく目も赤いですし
135.english: And his eyes are all red, too.

136.speaker: grizzly
136.japanese: 寝不足なんだよ 冬ごもりしてんだからな
136.english: That's because I haven't gotten enough sleep. I'm in the middle of hibernating.

138.speaker: grizzly
138.japanese: おう　とっとと済ますぞ
138.english: Yeah, let's get this over with.

140.speaker: sasako
140.japanese: ラマさん　大丈夫ですか
140.english: Are you all right, Mr. Llama?!

141.speaker: grizzly
141.japanese: 悪い　迫力出しすぎたな
141.english: S-Sorry about that. I guess that was too effective.

142.speaker: grizzly
142.japanese: もうちょっと手加減するから
142.english: I'll hold back a little more.

143.speaker: grizzly
143.japanese: はい　鬼だぞ　豆投げろ
143.english: All right, I'm an ogre. Throw beans at me!

147.speaker: grizzly
147.japanese: 降参だぜ　まいったぜ
147.english: I give up! I've had enough!

151.speaker: panda
151.japanese: グリズリーさんが来てくれてよかったね

152.speaker: grizzly
152.japanese: もう終わりか じゃあ　俺は帰るぜ
152.english: Are you done now? Then I'm going home.

153.speaker: sasako
153.japanese: せっかくですから 豆を食べていってください
153.english: Since you came,  please have some beans.

154.speaker: penguin
154.japanese: そうだよ　みんな年の数だけ豆を食べないと
154.english: Yeah. All of us have to eat our age in beans.

155.speaker: penguin
155.japanese: いっぱい食べると飽きるなぁ
155.english: You get tired of them after eating a lot.

156.speaker: polar bear
156.japanese: はい　他にも豆料理
156.english: Here you go, some other bean dishes.

157.speaker: polar bear
157.japanese: 豆入りのピラフに 肉そぼろと豆のレタス巻き
157.english: Bean pilaf, minced meat with beans wrapped in lettuce.

158.speaker: polar bear
158.japanese: チリコンカーンもあるよ
158.english: There's some chili con carne, too.

160.speaker: lesser
160.japanese: 恵方巻きもあるんですね

164.speaker: panda
164.japanese: ゾウガメさん　大変だね

165.speaker: polar bear
165.japanese: じゃあ　店番よろしくね　笹子さん
165.english: All right, please look after the Café, Miss Sasako.

166.speaker: sasako
166.japanese: はい　いってらっしゃい

168.speaker: sasako
168.japanese: グラスでも磨こうかな
168.english: I guess I should wipe some glasses.

170.speaker: sasako
170.japanese: もう　ずっと出てないしなぁ
170.english: I haven't been back in a while... {\a6}1. I will attend.2. I will not attend.

174.speaker: sasako
174.english: Here you go. Are you ready to order?

175.speaker: llama
175.japanese: コーヒーを　モカマタリで
175.english: Could I get a coffee, please? A cup of Mocha Matari.

176.speaker: sasako
176.english: Sure. Am I the only customer?

178.speaker: sasako
178.japanese: 今日　動物園はお休みなんですか
178.english: Are you off from the zoo today?

183.speaker: llama
183.japanese: この小学校僕が前に住んでいた家の
183.english: This elementary school is right by where I used to live.

187.speaker: llama
187.japanese: 笹子さん　あの小学校に通っていたんですね
187.english: So you attended that elementary school, Miss Sasako?

188.speaker: sasako
188.japanese: えぇ　ということはもしかして私とラマさん
188.english: I did. So does that mean you and I lived in the same city before, Mr. Llama?

190.speaker: llama
190.japanese: こんな偶然あるんですね

191.speaker: sasako
191.japanese: じゃあ　知ってます
191.english: Then do you know about this?

192.speaker: sasako
192.japanese: 小学校の信号渡って まっすぐ行って
192.english: If you cross at the light at the school and continue on,

193.speaker: sasako
193.japanese: しばらくしたところにあるパン屋さん
193.english: there's a bakery if you walk a little further down.

195.speaker: sasako
195.japanese: そうです　あすなろベーカリー

196.speaker: llama
196.japanese: クリームパンがおいしい

197.speaker: sasako
197.japanese: えぇ　葉っぱの形をしたクリームパン

198.speaker: llama
198.japanese: カスタードクリームがたっぷりで
198.english: There's so much pastry cream in it.

199.speaker: sasako
199.japanese: 私　あれ大好きだったんです

201.speaker: sasako
201.japanese: それであすなろベーカリーを右に曲がって
201.english: And then, if you turn right at the Asunaro Bakery,

202.speaker: sasako
202.japanese: キリンさんの家を過ぎたところの…
202.english: and go a little past Mr. Giraffe's house...

205.speaker: llama
205.japanese: よくあそこで遊びました
205.english: I played there quite a bit.

206.speaker: sasako
206.english: So did I. Oh, and the person who was always cleaning it...

209.speaker: llama
209.japanese: ちゃんとゴミ捨てないと すっごく怒るんですよね
209.english: He always got angry when you didn't throw trash away properly.

210.speaker: sasako
210.japanese: ちゃんとゴミを捨てても 怒るんですよ
210.english: He got mad even if you did.

211.speaker: sasako
211.english: He'd say that you weren't throwing it away right.

212.speaker: llama
212.japanese: いつだったか怒られたときに こっそりアカンベーしたら…
212.english: One time when he got angry with me, I sneakily stuck my tongue out at him,

213.speaker: llama
213.japanese: ３時間くらい洗い物を手伝わされました
213.english: and then he made me help him wash for three hours.

215.speaker: llama
215.japanese: その頃ちょっとやんちゃだったもので

218.speaker: sasako
218.japanese: いけない コーヒー出すの忘れてました
218.english: Oh, no! I forgot to bring out your coffee!

221.speaker: sasako
221.japanese: ありがとうございます

222.speaker: llama
222.japanese: それで　笹子さんが住んでた家は 杉の子公園の…
222.english: So, where was your house in relation to Suginoko Park?

223.speaker: sasako
223.japanese: はす向かいにお風呂屋さんありましたよね
223.english: You know the bathhouse diagonally opposite the park? Oh, the Hama no Yu Bathhouse?

224.speaker: sasako
224.japanese: そう　その浜の湯の裏が家だったんです
224.english: Right! My house was just on the other side. Ah, by Hama no Yu.

225.speaker: llama
225.japanese: なぜか店の前に 桶を持ったカエルの人形が置いてあったんですよね
225.english: And for some reason, there was a small statue of a frog holding a bucket out front. Oh, that's right, the frog! And he had a towel on top of his head.

226.speaker: llama
226.japanese: 後ろ向きで１００円投げて中に入ると
226.english: They said that if you faced backwards and tossed a 100 yen coin in,

227.speaker: llama
227.japanese: いいことがあるって言われてましたけど…
227.english: that something good would happen, but...

228.speaker: sasako
228.japanese: あれ絶対浜の湯のおじさんが言いふらしてたんですよね
228.english: I'm sure the owner of the bathhouse was just saying that.

229.speaker: llama
229.japanese: そうに決まってますよ
229.english: Of course. This is all so nostalgic.

231.speaker: sasako
231.japanese: 浜の湯のカエルのことなんて すっかり忘れてました
231.english: I had totally forgotten about the frog in front of Hama no Yu. Oh, why don't you have a seat, as well, Miss Sasako?

232.speaker: sasako
232.japanese: そうですね お客さんいないし　ちょっとだけ
232.english: You're right. There aren't any customers, so it won't hurt.

233.speaker: panda
233.japanese: ありがとうございました

234.speaker: polar bear
234.english: Were you able to get it?

236.speaker: penguin
236.english: Why did we have to tag along, too?

237.speaker: polar bear
237.japanese: だって　１人だと大変でしょ
237.english: Because it's hard work collecting dues

238.japanese: 町内会の会費集めるの

240.speaker: polar bear
240.japanese: じゃあ　ちょっと休んでいこうか
240.english: Then let's take a little break.

242.speaker: polar bear
242.japanese: 笹子さんに任せてるから
242.english: I've left Miss Sasako in charge.

244.speaker: llama
244.japanese: 笹子さん 浜の湯の裏に住んでたんですか
244.english: So, you lived right behind Hama no Yu?

245.speaker: llama
245.japanese: じゃあ　きっと前を通ったことあるな
245.english: Then I've probably passed it before.

246.speaker: sasako
246.japanese: いちじくのある家ですよ
246.english: It's the house with the fig tree, though it was chopped down when I was in elementary school.

247.speaker: llama
247.japanese: そうですか　覚えがないな
247.english: I see. I don't think I remember it.

248.japanese: あの町にいた頃は幼稚園児でしたし
248.english: I was in preschool when I lived in that city. Wait, if you were in preschool when I was in elementary school,

249.speaker: sasako
249.japanese: もしかして　ラマさんのほうが年下
249.english: does that mean that you're younger than me, Mr. Llama?

250.speaker: llama
250.japanese: あれ　そうですかね
250.english: Oh, I could be. Oh, I see...

251.speaker: sasako
251.japanese: ラマさん私より下なのか

252.speaker: llama
252.japanese: いやいや　笹子さん僕よりずっと若く見えますから
252.english: Oh, don't worry, Miss Sasako. You look much younger than I do.

253.speaker: sasako
253.japanese: じゃあ　同じ町内だったら
253.english: Then since we lived in the same city, you know about the festival at the Megamo Shrine?

258.japanese: 西のほうに大きな風車があったのって
258.english: Do you remember there being a large windmill in the west?

260.speaker: sasako
260.japanese: 私　小２の夏休みのとき
260.english: When I was in second grade, during summer vacation,

261.japanese: どうしても　あの風車のところまで行ってみたくなって…
261.english: I was determined to get to that windmill.

262.speaker: sasako
262.japanese: あんな大きな風車の下に行ったら
262.english: I thought there would be a lot of wind by that giant windmill... Enough for me to fly.

263.speaker: sasako
263.japanese: リュックに水筒とあすなろベーカリーのクリームパンを入れて
263.english: I put my water bottle and Asunaro Bakery's cream bread in my backpack

264.speaker: sasako
264.english: and started walking. But no matter how much I walked, the windmill didn't get any closer.

265.speaker: sasako
265.japanese: だんだんと日も暮れてきて

266.japanese: クリームパンは潰れちゃって
266.english: my cream bread got smushed, and the water in my water bottle ran out.

267.speaker: sasako
267.japanese: だけど どうしても行ってみたくて
267.english: But I still wanted to get there, no matter what. I wanted to fly.

268.speaker: sasako
268.japanese: そのとき　家では大騒ぎになってたらしいんですけどね
268.english: I apparently caused a commotion at my house in the meanwhile, though. Oh!

269.speaker: llama
269.japanese: ありました　そんなこと

270.speaker: llama
270.japanese: 小学生の女の子が迷子になったって
270.english: I remember hearing that an elementary school girl got lost.

271.speaker: llama
271.english: So that little girl was you, Miss Sasako?

273.speaker: llama
273.japanese: どうしたのかなって ずっと気になってました
273.english: I kept wondering what happened to her.

274.speaker: llama
274.japanese: 無事に帰ってきたんですね
274.english: So, you made it home safely.

275.speaker: sasako
275.english: I'm sorry for the trouble I caused.

276.speaker: llama
276.japanese: よかったです　あの女の子がこんなに大きくなって
276.english: I'm relieved. That girl has grown up, and is working very hard.

277.speaker: sasako
277.japanese: でも　あれから何度も探したんですけど
277.english: I tried several more times to find my way to the windmill,

278.speaker: sasako
278.japanese: 結局　あの風車には行けませんでした
278.english: but I never did make it.

280.speaker: panda
280.japanese: あれ　お客さん誰もいないね

281.speaker: penguin
281.japanese: ラマさんがいるじゃない
281.english: Mr. Llama is right there. Oh, you're right.

283.speaker: panda
283.japanese: 疲れた バイトだと全然疲れないのに…
283.english: I'm beat. I never get tired at my part-time job.

284.speaker: penguin
284.japanese: パンダ君のバイトはゴロゴロしてるだけっていうか
284.english: That's because all you do is lay around.

285.speaker: penguin
285.english: You should actually try working harder, you know?

286.speaker: polar bear
286.japanese: おかげで集まったよ 町内会の会費
286.english: Thanks to you, we were able to collect all the dues for the neighborhood association.

287.speaker: sasako
287.english: Thank you for all of your hard work.

292.speaker: girl 1
292.japanese: 奥の席 いいですか
292.english: Could we take the table near the back?

294.speaker: girl 2
294.english: So, as I was saying earlier...

295.speaker: sasako
295.japanese: ニューヨークチーズケーキと アップルパイ ブレンドとアールグレイですね
295.english: A New York cheesecake and an apple pie, then one house blend coffee and an Earl Grey tea.

296.speaker: sasako
296.japanese: 少々　お待ちください

298.speaker: sasako
298.japanese: ラマさん　お帰りですか
298.english: Oh, Mr. Llama, are you heading out?

300.speaker: sasako
300.japanese: ありがとうございました
300.english: Thank you very much. I'll come again.

301.speaker: sasako
301.english: Yes. Oh, Miss Sasako, I've gone before, too.

302.speaker: llama
302.japanese: お父さんとですけどねえ
302.english: But I was with my father.

303.speaker: llama
303.japanese: あれ実は　風車じゃなくて 風力発電の塔だったんです
303.english: It wasn't actually a windmill, but a wind station's turbine. I wasn't able to fly,

304.speaker: llama
304.japanese: すごく風が気持よかったですよ
304.english: but the wind felt very nice.

305.speaker: sasako
305.japanese: はい　今度　行ってみます
305.english: All right. I'll try and go next time.

307.speaker: penguin
307.japanese: なに　この通じ合った空気は
307.english: Why do they seem so close all of a sudden?

309.speaker: polar bear
309.japanese: 笹子さん ブレンドとアールグレイ　入ったよ
309.english: Miss Sasako, the house blend and Earl Grey are ready. Oh, right.

310.speaker: sasako
310.english: Thank you for all of your hard work!

311.speaker: panda
311.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

313.speaker: panda
313.japanese: ペンギンさんが知ってるおしゃれな言葉を聞かせて
313.english: Tell me some fancy word you know, Mr. Penguin.

315.speaker: panda
315.japanese: だじゃれじゃなくておしゃれ
315.english: Women's work pants {\i1}(monpe){\i0}? Not a pun {\i1}(dajare){\i0}, he said fancy {\i1}(oshare){\i0}.

316.speaker: sasako
316.japanese: ペンギンさん　終わらなくていいですか
316.english: Mr. Penguin, don't we have to end this?

317.speaker: penguin
317.japanese: いい　今日はいつまでも話していたい気分なんだ
317.english: Nope. I sort of want to keep talking for a while today.

320.speaker: polar bear
320.english: Next week on, Oh! Polar Bear's Café... You don't have to try so hard to change it.

323.speaker: penguin
323.japanese: 攻め込むな　笹子さん
323.english: You're not gonna give up, are you, Miss Sasako?
